alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Hancock; Seneca; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 12:29PM EDT until August 12 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Seneca County in northwestern Ohio... Northern Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Northwestern Crawford County in north central Ohio... Southeastern Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 115 PM EDT. * At 1228 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Vanlue, or 7 miles southeast of Findlay, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Fostoria, Bloomville, Sycamore, Vanlue, New Riegel, Carey, Republic, Wharton and Bascom. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
